s_synopsis: Set in 2090, the story of Front Mission takes place on Huffman Island, a Pacific Ocean island created by volcanic activity south of Mexico's west coast in 1995. In 2002, the land mass was classified as an island and ceded to United Nations control. However, in 2020, the United States of the New Continent (USN) made a bid for control of the island after withdrawing from the United Nations. The Oceania Cooperative Union (OCU), an alliance of Oriental Asian nations and Australia that was created in 2025, dispute this claim when the two superpowers colonized the island in 2065. The tensions heat up and eventually lead to the 1st Huffman Conflict in 2070, with Huffman Island being divided into two halves at the end of the war. An uneasy peace is maintained until the Huffman Crisis in 2086, when a series of skirmishes across the island causes chaos. Tensions flare up and end in war when the OCU is blamed for inciting the Larcus Incident on June 3, 2090.
